Package se.arkalix.security

Class X509Names

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.arkalix.security.X509Names
  • public class X509Names
extends java.lang.Object
    Various utilities for working with LDAP Distinguished Names (DNs), which are, most significantly, used to identify the issuer and subject of x.509 certificates.
    See Also:
    RFC 5280, Section 4.1

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

    • Method Detail

      • arrowheadNameOf

        public static java.util.Optional<X509ArrowheadName> arrowheadNameOf​(java.lang.String dn)
                                                             throws X509NameException
        Searches for and extracts the Common Name (CN) from given DN, and then converts it into an X509ArrowheadName.

        As an LDAP DN is hierarchical, with the top level being the rightmost Relative DN (RDN), the leftmost RDN containing a CN is assumed to contain the most specific domain name. If multiple CNs are stated in provided DN, only the leftmost CN is converted and returned.

        Parameters:
        dn - String representation of LDAP DN, as described in RFC 4515, Section 3, as well as RFC 4512, Section 1.4.
        Returns:
        x.509 Arrowhead name, if a valid CN is present in given DN string.
        Throws:
        X509NameException - If provided DN string is not standards- compliant.
        See Also:
        RFC 4515, Section 3, RFC 4512, Section 1.4

      • commonNameOf

        public static java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> commonNameOf​(java.lang.String dn)
                                                         throws X509NameException
        Identifies and extracts leftmost Common Name (CN) in given LDAP DN.

        As an LDAP DN is hierarchical, with the top level being the rightmost Relative DN (RDN), the leftmost RDN containing a CN is assumed to contain the most specific domain name. If multiple CNs are stated in provided DN, only the leftmost CN is returned.

        Parameters:
        dn - String representation of an LDAP DN, as described in RFC 4515, Section 3, as well as RFC 4512, Section 1.4.
        Returns:
        Extracted, escaped and whitespace-trimmed CN, if any such exists in given DN.
        Throws:
        X509NameException - If provided DN string is not standards- compliant.
        See Also:
        RFC 4515, Section 3, RFC 4512, Section 1.4
